title: Warhammer 40k Space Marine 2's new Techmarine class can turn the environment to their advantage
contents: Saber Interactive has an early holiday treat for us, courtesy of a first proper look at the Warhammer 40k Space Marine 2 Techmarine. title: The biggest Warhammer 40k game ever just got a free demo, and it's 55% off if you like what you see
contents: I've played Warhammer for over two-thirds of my life. I started, as with all men of a similar age, with The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game, and quickly moved onto Warhammer 40k and then Fantasy. I've dabbled in Age of Sigmar and tend to play a lot more independent games these days, but 40k will always hold a place in my heart for introducing me to all things grimdark. Peter Jackson's iconic trilogy pulled me into this gothic universe, but modern players are being inspired to get their paints out by videogames like Warhammer 40k Space Marine 2. If you're one of the few players thus far unswayed by Lieutenant Titus' gory action title, perhaps a free demo will induct you into the ranks of the Ultramarines. Read the rest of the story... title: Space Marine 2 developer already knows you'll hate the new Blood Angels skin
contents: Warhammer 40k Space Marine 2 developer Saber Interactive isn't stopping the update train. Hot on the heels of the huge anniversary update, Saber has teased what's next for the game. We already knew that a Blood Angels Champion Pack would be arriving thanks to the anniversary roadmap, but we didn't know a lot about it. I'll be honest, there's good news and bad news. The bad news, which most loyal sons of Sanguinius will hold onto, is that the Blood Angels cosmetic is only for the Tactical class. However, there's a silver lining. Read the rest of the story... title: Warhammer 40k Space Marine 2 update fixes friendly fire and nerfs sniper cloak
contents: A new Warhammer 40k Space Marine 2 update today has a blend of good and bad news for players. Saber Interactive's Patch 10 recently beefed up its high-octane, Tyranid-trouncing and Chaos-carving experience with new PvE and PvP modes, and it's been watching the balance carefully since. Now, it's made the call to tackle sniper cloak abuse a little earlier than planned, rushing out an adjustment that was originally on the cards for Patch 11. Among the other changes are a much-needed fix for bugs causing accidental friendly fire damage, which should make your matches less hostile. Read the rest of the story... title: Patch Notes 10.2
contents: â€‹Hello Space Marines,A new hotfix is now live on every platform. It fixes critical issues such as the Assaultâ€™s Ascension perk dealing friendly-fire damage, Stratagems having more Battlefield Conditions than listed and more. Also, the Sniperâ€™s Camo Cloak activation cost change (which was initially planned for 11.0) has also been pushed on this update. Read the complete patch notes below:PATCH NOTESGAMEPLAY AND BALANCING TWEAKSHeroic Chainsword:Rebalanced base stats.Reworked its perk: Light->Heavy->Heavy combo now ends with a Stomp attack.All Heavy attacks damage increased by 15%.Stratagems:Fixed an issue where Daily Stratagems could have more Battlefield Conditions than listed.Camo Cloak's activation cost:The activation cost of the Sniper ability has been changed. Now it works this way:Â The first three uses of Camo Cloak in a row do not take away energy by themselves (the ability consumes energy, as before). The fourth activation takes away 5% of energy instantly, each subsequent one takes away a little more. After the last use, there is a 10-second timer, after which the activation cost again becomes zero.With the right perk set up, you can still do 5-6 cloak cancels in a row. Cloak cancel will still be very rewarding to learn and to do, but you won't be able to abuse it endlessly while staying invisible and invulnerable to enemies.Spawn Director:The number of Chaos Spawns in packs is slightly reduced and now matches Tyranid Warriors.GENERAL FIXESFixed damage for the Power Backstep attack when the Power Wave perk is selected for Power Axe.Improved flame weapons VFX visibility for allies.Fixed an issue that prevented bots from entering elevators in Exfiltration operation.Fixed perks dealing friendly fire damage.Fixed PvP connectivity issues.Minor localization fixes.Minor UI fixes.ESRB update pop-up: A pop-up will appear on the main menu to inform you of an update of the ESRB rating. This pop-up will only appear once.Â Please note that this update of our rating is just here to properly reflect what was already in-game for several months. There has been no change to our monetization system, and no changes are planned.

title: August Community Update
contents: Greetings Space Marines,We hope you had a wonderful and sunny summertime. â˜€ï¸The whole team wants to thank you for the warm welcome you gave to the previous Community Update. We were so pleased to see your enthusiasm for the Chaos Spawn, Black Templars, the new PVP game mode, etc!You also asked us for news about Techmarine, and we've got some this month!This Community Update has a bunch of surprises and a community survey, so read it carefully! ğŸ˜‰Letâ€™s start off with the BIG news! âœ¨YEAR 2 IS JUST ROUND THE CORNER!Weâ€™re so close! The second year of content for Space Marine 2 is about to begin.Letâ€™s take a look at the free content first and then DLC Content, in this trailer!Expect the Patches to be released at a similar pace to what we were used to during the first year of content updates. Several PVE missions, the Techmarine class coming with Patch 12, cosmetics for Blood Angels, Carcharodons, Iron Hands and much more await with this Season Pass.Check the Roadmap! PATCH 10 - ANNIVERSARY UPDATE The Anniversary Update is planned to be rolled out onÂ September 4! Itâ€™s a free update, but also marks the release of the Season Pass II and its first two DLCs. ğŸ“…Â Letâ€™s see the content of this Patch in more detail, shall we?THE CHAOS ARMOUR PACK:The Chaos Armour Pack is coming for free. Youâ€™ll finally be able to change the armour set of your Heretic Astartes in PvP, but youâ€™ll have to unlock the set first. Each class will require you to score a certain amount of kills per match to unlock the corresponding skin.NEW GAME MODES:Â HELBRUTE ONSLAUGHT (PVP)A brand new mode will be added with this update, and will be playable on all maps. Hereâ€™s your brief:Two teams of Chaos Marines will fight to control strategic areas, but also to take control of the Helbrute. The first team to take control of an objective gets to control the Helbrute, until the opposite team takes it down. One player gets to control the Helbrute at a time, and this player will be picked randomly among players who participated in securing the control point. For the team that failed to secure the first control point to have the Helbrute on their side, they will need to slay their opponentsâ€™ Helbrute and secure a new designated control point. Controlling the Helbrute grants the team a strong advantage, but killing it rewards significant amounts of points to your team. One last thing, the Helbrute uses a Helbrute Thunder Hammer in melee, and a Plasma Cannon in range, and it can unleash a battle cry with its special skill to regenerate its HP.STRATAGEMS (PVE)Stratagems are a completely new PvE game mode. title: Patch Notes 8.0 - Siege Update
contents: â€‹Hi Space Marines!The 8.0 â€œSiege updateâ€ is now live on every platform! Hereâ€™s a quick summary of its content:New FeaturesNew PvE Mode â€” SiegeSiege Mode expands on our PVE operations, emphasizing endless enemy waves that challenge even the strongest teams. When overwhelmed, players may call reinforcements for assistance. Engage in intense battles across three distinctive sectors, each requiring strategic adaptation. Side objectives emerge during combat, providing essential resources used to summon elite Space Marines or a formidable Dreadnought, drastically shifting battlefield dynamics.The BattlefieldThe battle unfolds within a fortified Imperial stronghold on Kadaku, relentlessly attacked by endless waves of Tyranid and Thousand Sons enemies. The fortress has three rotating sectors: Defensive Positions, the Arsenal, and the Control Room. In each sector, you will face five waves of enemies before your squad advances to the next sector, ultimately cycling back to reinforce earlier positions.Survival Against WavesFace increasingly challenging enemy waves, with direct assaults from Tyranids and cunning sabotage by Chaos forces. Brief (1 minute) intermissions between waves offer strategic opportunities, clearly indicated through UI notifications.Side ObjectivesDynamic tasks such as capturing strategic points or retrieving Data-slates from fallen allies deepen tactical gameplay and supply critical resources essential for continued survival.Shop and ReinforcementsEarn Siege Mode resources through successful combat and Side Objective completion. You can spend these resources at the fortress Shop. You can:Buy ammunition, medicae stimms, equipment, armour boosts, guardian relic (these items have the same exact behaviour as in Operations Mode).Summon specialized Space Marines providing targeted support and bonuses. Each player can have only one summoned Space Marine.Deploy Cadian Troopers to provide additional firepower.Â Note about reinforcements changes from the PTS: guardsmen are now cheaper. 4. Collectively pool your resources to unleash the devastating power of a Dreadnought.Boss EncountersEvery fifth wave introduces formidable boss battles, occasionally facing multiple elite foes simultaneously. Triumph in these encounters to progress to new fortress sectors.Infinite WavesIf your resolve endures through fifteen brutal waves, prepare for endless combat of increasing difficulty, reduced resources, and shorter preparation times. Even the Primarch of the Ultramarines understands that ultimate victory here is unlikely â€” but your bravery will echo through the halls of eternity.Note about timer changes from PTS:The biggest criticism regarding Siege mode from the community was the wave timer limit. It exists only for technical reasons. In this build we've made some optimizations so the Siege mode can last longer. title: The Public Test Server opens once again!
contents: Hi Space Marines! â­ The Public Test Server opens once more today! Check out this quick FAQ to help you get started and ready before launch. â€ {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/0a6ea410f462d2a5b6950db04e11ef0cb86b247b.png â€ Whatâ€™s a Public Test Server? Space Marine 2â€™s Public Test Server works as a separate version of the game featuring WIP content and features. Share your feedback to help us refine the patch before its official release. Your input provides an important perspective that will be reviewed by the developer team and have an impact on further game updates. Since this is a test environment, expect the unfinished content and possible bugs. As you will access it through a different game version, your progression will not be tracked. For each PTS update, you will land on the game with levels maxed out and all weapons unlocked. Please note that the DLCs wonâ€™t be available, regardless of whether you own them. â€ Since the PTS is "Public", you are free to create content based on it. No NDA will be included. Which platforms can access the PTS? The PTS is only available on PC via Steam. It is not accessible on consoles (PlayStation/Xbox) or through the Epic Games Store. Now, letâ€™s see how to install it ğŸ‘‡ â€ ğŸ“ Tutorial on how to access PTS via Steam: Just follow these simple steps: Open the Steam client. Log in with the account that owns Space Marine 2. Go to your Steam Library. Look for â€œWarhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 - Public Test Serverâ€ under your Space Marine 2 entry. (Optional) Right-click on your Library entry and go to Properties. In the â€œGeneralâ€ tab, set the gameâ€™s default Language to â€œEnglishâ€. Translations may still be work-in-progress when you try the new content out on the PTS. As a result, we recommend setting the game to English. Once youâ€™ve clicked on this entry, install the Public Test Server content. This install instance is not related to the base game, your files will remain in separate directories and all future updates will also be distinct, meaning that your current progression will not be affected by the time you spend on the PTS. When the install is complete, the Public Test Server is ready to launch! Click â€œPlayâ€ like you would with any other game! â€ Can I try every single feature that will be implemented with the next Patch? Most upcoming content will be available to you. However, we wonâ€™t share content that is too buggy or hasnâ€™t undergone the necessary approvals on our side at the time of the PTS release. Also, some content might be present on the PTS, but not accessible to the players. For instance, you may see new Champions in the Armouring Hall but wonâ€™t be able to try them unless you own the Season Pass. â€ How long will the PTS be active? The PTS will run until Patch 8.0 officially launches. After that, it will go dormant until the next major PTS update. â€ Will my progress be saved? No, because the PTS runs as a completely separate game version. It does not carry over your previous progress in the game; instead, it provides all players with a default maxed-out level and weapons. This ensures that you wonâ€™t have to spend time to unlock all the features, especially the Prestige Ranks. It will also not save your progress nor transfer it to the official game version afterwards. â€ Is multiplayer available on the PTS? Yes, even private PvP lobbies will work so you can invite your Brothers and Sisters to play! â€ Do mods work with the PTS? Mods won't work with the PTS. Enabling them will cause the PTS to crash at launch. Please, make sure to disable them beforehand. â€ How can I give feedback? We need your feedback! As mentioned in previous Community Updates, the primary purpose of the Public Test Server is to gather your feedback on new content, changes, and balancing tweaks we plan to implement in the game. Our main focus will be on PvE Siege Mode and Absolute Difficulty balancing. Weâ€™ve set up dedicated forum threads on Focus Together to let you voice your opinion, which you can find here. Thank you for helping us make Space Marine 2 the best it can be!

title: Patch Notes 7.0
contents: â€‹Hi Space Marines! The 7.0 â€œTrygon updateâ€ is now live and brings a lot of changes to Space Marine 2! Before diving into the update, hereâ€™s a quick summary of its content: New Features: New PvE Operation: Exfiltration Prestige Ranks in PvE Private PvP Lobbies New Secondary Weapon in PvE and PvP: Inferno Pistol New customisation options: 2 new colours, Bulwark cloth colouring, hands colouring New Season Pass content: Space Wolves Chapter Pack Imperial Fists Champion Pack Gameplay & Balancing: Extended weapon arsenal in PvE Weapon perks updated in PvE Improved Matchmaking in PvE and PvP Various changes, bugfixes and improvements {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/07daefbb4a1d22617d0d1da295c3986fdab0868d.png â€” Dmitriy Grigorenko, Game Director PATCH NOTES New Features New Operation â€” Exfiltration Exfiltration takes place on Avarax at the outskirts of an Imperial Hive City ravaged by the Tyranids.. Your mission is to reach a Mechanicus facility, extract a rogue Tech-Priest and fight a Trygon; a giant, burrowing Tyranid that creates underground passageways for other Tyranid organisms. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/2efdd2cf86834005d666c3dd714446afad285c09.png Private Lobbies in PvP A custom lobby to invite your fellow Space Marines. You can choose the mode and map, and also change the gameplay settings, like score or time limit or even damage modifiers to create your own fun game modes. Prestige Ranks in PvE The Prestige system allows you to continue empowering your Class even after reaching the maximum level. Once you have reached level 25, go to the Armouring Hall and follow the activation procedure in the Skill Tree screen. There, you can reset the Class' progress to the first level to unlock one Prestige Perk. After this, you can raise the Class level to 25 again. Thus, a Class can get up to 4 active Prestige Perks simultaneously. Each prestige rank increases XP gain by 10%. Progressing your Prestige ranks will also grant you unique cosmetic rewards for each rank you unlock. PvE Extended List of Available Weapons Heavy: Heavy Bolt Rifle | Heavy Bolt Pistol Tactical: Combat Knife | Plasma Pistol | Heavy Bolt Pistol Assault: Power Sword | Plasma Pistol Bulwark: Heavy Bolt Pistol Sniper: Heavy Bolt Pistol | Instigator Bolt Carbine Vanguard: Heavy Bolt Pistol | Bolt Carbine Originally the classes were not balanced around having these weapons. Some of those changes are only meant to bring more variety, fun and lore accuracy to the game. Not every change here will make every weapon competitive with the rest of class loadouts. This isn't the last pass on this, we will continue to monitor the game and make necessary changes. We still have some more ideas how we can expand loadouts more, without breaking the lore and while keeping class identity, but those changes will take a while to implement. New Secondary Weapon: Inferno Pistol Available for Sniper, Heavy, Assault and Vanguard classes. Class-based matchmaking in Operations mode This is a first iteration of the system that is designed to reduce frequency of matchmaking with other people with the same classes. It is not going to prevent this 100%, there will always be some edge cases. We will be tweaking and improving the system on our backend as we go. Experimental skill-based matchmaking and team balancing in Eternal War mode This system should make matchmaking in PvP more fair. This is an experimental feature, we will be turning it on and off on the backend and monitoring the results. It will take a while for it to shape up. Public Test Server (PTS) We are really happy with the PTS experiment that we had. We got a lot of feedback from the community that allowed us to implement changes ahead of actual live release. While having PTS is an additional stress for our team and will cause some delays to live patches we are going to keep doing that for all major content updates moving forward. The PTS will be closed for now, but weâ€™ll reopen it once weâ€™ll be looking for your feedback on upcoming features. New Season Pass Content Space Wolves Chapter Pack: - Space Wolves Chapter Champion (Vanguard). - Space Wolves Chapter Weapon Skins (Bolt Carbine, Thunder Hammer, Chainsword). - Space Wolves Chapter Customisation (Helmet, Chest, Pauldron, Greave, Heraldry markings). {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/a23bd933bf6de3953f589ab4321607a22b467a93.jpg Imperial Fists Champion Pack: - Imperial Fists Champion (Tactical). - Imperial Fists Signature Weapon Skin (Plasma Incinerator). {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/33468439454839669c5da543c35d6b18cb3eca9c.jpg Customisation New Colours: New default colours Volupus Pink and Thousand Sons Blue. title: Yes, Warhammer 40,000 Space Marine 3 is in the works, but that doesn't mean Space Marine 2 is already dead
contents: These days, most sequels to even the most popular of games are announced a good while after whatever the latest title is. I mean, just look at The Witcher 4, we've known it's been in the works for a while now, but it only got a formal reveal last December, almost a full decade after The Witcher 3. Saber didn't wait around to announce a follow-up to last year's very popular Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2, though, revealing that a third game is in the works just this month, about half a year on from its release. Even still, Saber would like you to know that this doesn't mean it's "abandoning" Space Marine 2. Read more

title: Space Marine 2 dev says "no one is abandoning the game" in favor of the sequel
contents: Warhammer 40k Space Marine 2 might be getting a sequel, but developer Saber Interactive is keen to reassure players that the current iteration isn't going away any time soon. As its first round of PTS testing rolls on, the developer outlines what's still ahead for SM2. Read the rest of the story... title: March Community Update
contents: Greetings Brothers and Sisters, Many announcements have taken place throughout March. Letâ€™s rewind a bit, and then letâ€™s dive into the upcoming content! Weâ€™ll also tackle the polls taken to make the Absolute Difficulty more to your liking. MONTHâ€™S REWIND Weâ€™ve made a huge announcement â­â­â­ Mid-March, we announced that Space Marine 3 had begun development and weâ€™re excited to see your enthusiasm, although we hear those of you who fear for Space Marine 2 and its future support. So let us set the record straight: Space Marine 3 does not mean the end of Space Marine 2's development. â€‹Far from it. No teams are shifting over, no one is abandoning the game, and our plans to bring more awesome content to Space Marine 2 remain. We are working on much more content and surprises for the months to come, such as a new class, more operations, melee weapons, and more! Trust us, there are surprises even dataminers havenâ€™t found out about :) This announcement simply marks the genesis of a new project, years away from release. Weâ€™ve made a decision and have just started the process. Many of you were very excited for this project and this makes us incredibly happy and motivated. Thank you for the unwavering support. That being said, we still have a lot to offer to the players with Space Marine 2. We launched the PTS on March 13! The Public Test Server was made available mid-march and youâ€™ve been very dedicated and serious about it! {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/5ec61352a7be0277f5d94254c2a9496f54626c7b.png Weâ€™ve opened a forum on Focus Together to let you voice your opinion on the content featured in the PTS. Even if we might not have enough time on our hands to reply to every thread, weâ€™re collecting your thoughts and making adjustments on our side. So, thank you! We already started to compile your feedback, and weâ€™ll implement some of them directly on a PTS update that will come early April. Regarding your feedback on the PTS features, we want to tackle the most important one here: Prestige Perks are not gamechanger, they are too weak and not worth the effort. ğŸ’¬ Prestige Perks have not been conceived as game breaking perks meant to allow you to roll on late game content. Another way to say it is that we donâ€™t want the Prestige Perks to be so strong they become â€œmust-havesâ€ for higher difficulties. We really want to emphasize that you donâ€™t need Prestige Perks to beat Absolute difficulty. This would make grinding for them an obligation when we really want them as minor rewards for those who choose to pursue them. The idea behind Prestige Perks is to provide you with more replayability, so you actually have a purpose farming PvE content (other than purging for the Imperium of course!). We don't want players to feel like they need to base their builds upon prestige perks, otherwise it will feel like a forced grind. Donâ€™t forget that thereâ€™s a unique cosmetic for each class to unlock once you maxed out a class. Prestige Ranks are resetting the class progression to level 1, it will be tedious and too long to get level 25 again. ğŸ’¬ In recent updates we've increased the amount of xp players are getting in preparation for the prestige system. We've added extermination bonus, quick match bonus, plus new difficulties grant more xp. On top of that weâ€™ll add an XP bonus to make your post-prestige progression faster. Again, we are trying to strike the balance between having something to keep playing and not forcing players to grind for a hundred hours. The Prestige Perks for the Heavy Class are too centered around melee combat. ğŸ’¬ We are working on changes regarding the Heavyâ€™s Prestige Perks to better integrate them for Heavyâ€™s builds. Assault should have access to the Inferno Pistol! ğŸ’¬ Absolutely, thatâ€™s why weâ€™ll include the weapon to Assaultâ€™s options starting from the next PTS update. Join the players on Discord if you want to chat about this PTS and the future instances! â€ âŒ› Patch 7.0 - Trygon Update Patch 7.0 will be released in mid-April on all platforms. title: The PTS is coming - Get ready for it with this FAQ!
contents: Hi Space Marines! â­ The Public Test Server opens March 13! Check out this quick FAQ to help you get started and ready before launch. â€ {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/0a6ea410f462d2a5b6950db04e11ef0cb86b247b.png â€ Whatâ€™s a Public Test Server? Space Marine 2â€™s Public Test Server works as a separate version of the game featuring WIP content and features. Share your feedback to help us refine the patch before its official release. Your input provides an important perspective that will be reviewed by the developer team and have an impact on further game updates. Since this is a test environment, expect the unfinished content and possible bugs. As you will access it through a different game version, your progression will not be tracked. For each PTS update, you will land on the game with levels maxed out and all weapons unlocked. Please note that the DLCs wonâ€™t be available, regardless of whether you own them. â€ Since the PTS is "Public", you are free to create content based on it. No NDA will be included. Which platforms can access the PTS? The PTS is only available on PC via Steam. It is not accessible on consoles (PlayStation/Xbox) or through the Epic Games Store. Now, letâ€™s see how to install it ğŸ‘‡ â€ ğŸ“ Tutorial on how to access PTS via Steam: Just follow these simple steps: Open the Steam client. Log in with the account that owns Space Marine 2. Go to your Steam Library. Look for â€œWarhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 - Public Test Serverâ€ under your Space Marine 2 entry. (Optional) Right-click on your Library entry and go to Properties. In the â€œGeneralâ€ tab, set the gameâ€™s default Language to â€œEnglishâ€. Translations may still be work-in-progress when you try the new content out on the PTS. As a result, we recommend setting the game to English. Once youâ€™ve clicked on this entry, install the Public Test Server content. This install instance is not related to the base game, your files will remain in separate directories and all future updates will also be distinct, meaning that your current progression will not be affected by the time you spend on the PTS. When the install is complete, the Public Test Server is ready to launch! Click â€œPlayâ€ like you would with any other game! â€ Can I try every single feature that will be implemented with the next Patch? Most upcoming content will be available to you. However, we wonâ€™t share content that is too buggy or hasnâ€™t undergone the necessary approvals on our side at the time of the PTS release. Also, some content might be present on the PTS, but not accessible to the players. For instance, you may see new Champions in the Armouring Hall but wonâ€™t be able to try them. â€ How long will the PTS be active? The PTS will run until Patch 7.0 officially launches. After that, it will go dormant until the next major PTS update. â€ Will my progress be saved? No, because the PTS runs as a completely separate game version. It does not carry over your previous progress in the game; instead, it provides all players with a default maxed-out level and weapons. This ensures that you wonâ€™t have to spend time to unlock all the features, especially the Prestige Ranks. It will also not save your progress nor transfer it to the official game version afterwards. â€ Is multiplayer available on the PTS? Yes, even private PvP lobbies will work so you can invite your Brothers and Sisters to play! â€ Do mods work with the PTS? Mods won't work with the PTS. Enabling them will cause the PTS to crash at launch. Please, make sure to disable them beforehand. â€ How can I give feedback? We need your feedback! As mentioned in previous Community Updates, the primary purpose of the Public Test Server is to gather your feedback on new content, changes, and balancing tweaks we plan to implement in the game. title: Hotfix 6.2 Patch Notes
contents: Hello Space Marines, As announced in the February Community Update, hotfix 6.2 has been deployed on every platform. This is a small patch that mostly focuses on crash fixes and minor balancing tweaks in preparation of a major Patch 7 that would focus on weapon perks and weapon loadouts rebalance. As usual, if you encounter issues with this update, let us know by making a bug report here. You'll find the complete patch notes down below. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/0a6ea410f462d2a5b6950db04e11ef0cb86b247b.png PATCH NOTES General Fixes Datavault ordeal Shredding Shrapnel now requires to kill 2 enemies simultaneously with a single frag grenade instead of 3. Fixed an issue with the AI Director that could sometimes spawn too many spore mines for a very long period. Fixed several issues that would cause Assault class to teleport back after using its Jump Pack ability. Minor localization fixes. Perk PvE Updates Overall we are quite happy with 6.0 perks rebalance, we are seeing way more build variety for all classes across all difficulties and seeing people experimenting with their builds more. That being said, there are still some perks that will require more attention or even full rework. We will be monitoring the situation and will be making necessary tweaks. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/c741d6ad228423769275bff7e195c4362308e0d3.png Heightened Vigour: - Fixed not triggering by perfect Parry or Block in some cases. Close Targeting: - Damage increased from 15% to 25%. Concentrated Fire: - Bonus duration of the Auspex Scan zone increased from 40% to 60%. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/1abf8c6d07944560f7c6535488e606fe81f15ea4.png Perseverance: - Damage reduction bonus increased from 15% to 25%. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/49a8b1e1d75b916ba063b4bcda14fc04e773850c.png Restless Fortitude: - Damage reduction bonus increased from 20% to 40%. Tactical Prowess: - Minimum enemy HP for auto finisher increased from 25% to 33%. Unmatched Zeal: - Health regen bonus increased from 20% to 30%. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/b008de073c9e7e17f7c5410a6ebec4145b7304ca.png Block Break: - Damage increased from 25% to 50%. Evasion: - Fixed typo in the description, now it shows correct cooldown of 30 seconds instead of 15 seconds. Efficient Readiness: - Fixed typo in the description, now it shows correct 20% movement boost instead of 10%. Pattern of Excellence: - Fixed typo in the description, now it shows correct cooldown of 30 seconds instead of 180 seconds. Note: This perk was buffed in the 6.0 patch, but localization was not updated and it was missing in patch notes. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/6dc73b997ce968ed4d170cec92bf099029c43431.png Chapter Banner (starting perk): - Bonus health increased from 20% to 30%. Emergency Countermeasure: - Cooldown reduced from 120 to 90 seconds. Defensive Mastery: - Cooldown reduced from 120 to 90 seconds. Glory's Shield: - Now the perk protects not only from Ranged Damage but from all incoming Damage. Note: This should improve support Bulwark build a lot, since this perk doesn't impact Banner cooldown Invigorating Icon: - The ability regeneration slowdown has been fixed, but the regeneration penalty is now -50% instead of -100%. Note: This perk has been discussed a lot in previous patch notes and here are my honest thoughts on this. We've made a mistake making this perk in the first place. It changes the class behavior too much from what was originally intended. Bulwark is supposed to tank enemies and support his team mates, he isn't a dedicated healer. But players are now used to this playstyle a lot and now absolutely any change to this perk will cause negativity from the community. The perk itself is so powerful that it is simply mandatory, plus it also changes how the ability is used. Unlike other classes where abilities are used whenever the player wants, it turns the banner into an ability that the player saves for the very last moment. In our game it is absolutely fine, if you want to use it that way, but the problem is that with certain other perks you can bring its cooldown to ~20 seconds. This means that not picking this perk will be detrimental to your squad. No matter what the numbers on the neighboring perks, players will always stick to the ability to fully heal when needed. We want to come back and rework this perk or, rather, perk column in later patches, but this requires some time of experimenting and testing. For now we are tweaking numbers to make a compromise between previous patch and community feedback. - Dmitriy Grigorenko, Game Director. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/8884de443755dac7bb5665350a070df9cb37914c.png Fortitude: - Health increases from 20% to 30%. Conversion Field: - Radius increased from 10 to 20 meters. Weapons Balancing Power Sword We are very happy with the current melee balance. All melee options are now viable and getting picked by players across all difficulties. However, we see that Power Sword isn't strong enough, compared to much easier to wield Chainsword. It takes...

title: February Community Update
contents: Hello Space Marines ğŸ«¡ Letâ€™s recap what occurred in February on Space Marine 2 a bit and then weâ€™ll tackle future topics! We know you're eager for Patch 7 to drop! There's still a bit of a wait, but in the meantime, we'll be sure to tease you a little. FEBRUARY RECAP This month we released the 6.0 Datavault Update, containing new free and Season Pass content. You may check the entire changelog here! ğŸ“– Mostly, the biggest features that were added to the game are: The Datavault, with new cosmetic rewards The Biovore New PvP Map â€œTombâ€ Salamanders Champion Pack Raven Guard Cosmetic Pack including its Successor Chapters FOV Slider Perks rework Following that, we released the 6.1 Hotfix to help with a few remaining bugs and connectivity issues, mostly. Again, you can read the patch notes here. We are aware that with these two updates, a few issues remain, such as: FPS drops Too many spore mines spawning at the same time Weâ€™re actively working on it. Hotfix 6.2 will arrive next week. It shall fix the spore mines issue and bring some balancing tweaks. IMPERIAL VIGIL COMMUNITY EVENT We heard about your desire to have an emblem-less Mk VIII Errant Helmet, so hereâ€™s your chance! âœ¨ This cosmetic is entirely free, the only requirement is to link your PROS account to Space Marine 2. Hereâ€™s your brief: â€œAchieve a victory with each of 6 classes in Operations Mode to win the emblem-less Mark VIII Errant Helmetâ€ {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/876731048e75bea664881bc7949c13b396be58a9.png The event lasts until March 3rd. NOTE ABOUT COMMUNITY EVENTS We have noted that the Community Events have received cold feedback since we introduced them as an additional way to unlock cosmetic items. We saw that many of you mentioned FOMO generated by the events. Rest assured, we are not looking to transform Space Marine 2 into a full live service game. The items available through events WILL be available later, for everyone. We want Community Events to be a way to unlock the items in advance, for the most dedicated players, and not to be a source of frustration and stress for everyone. However, that means we must provide a smooth experience in unlocking said items, which has not been the case so far. We deeply apologize for the trouble, and are currently working on a simplified process to unlock the items, to make the experience less constraining. WHATâ€™S COMINGâ€¦ The 7.0 Update is in the making! âœ¨ Weâ€™re working on it and weâ€™ll give you a more precise date once we get one. ğŸ™Œ This update will bring several awaited features: One Chapter Pack One Champion Pack Private PvP lobbies A new weapon (only in PvE for now) New Operation Weapon perks rebalance Class weapon loadouts rework PvE Prestige Rank: once you reach level 25 on a class, you can buy a Prestige Level that will unlock a unique Prestige Perk. Choose them wisely, because you wonâ€™t be able to change your selected Prestige Perks before unlocking the 4 Prestige Levels. On top of that power boost, each class will have a unique cosmetic reward that emphasizes the classâ€™ iconic armour part. and more! Stay tuned, weâ€™ll soon come with more info. HORDE MODE {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/6f4bd2012c6235fab5e95505ccc44b45a4d0c5db.png â€¦..So apparently youâ€™re waiting for the Horde Mode. Youâ€™re very eager to get more info on the Horde Mode, itâ€™s one of our top priorities right now. One thing we can say is that it will be very different from the Space Marine 1 Horde Mode, and that there are surprises we canâ€™t wait for you to find out about. ğŸ˜‰ Once we get really interesting things to show you about it, we will do it! Bear with us ğŸ™ PUBLIC TEST SERVER Weâ€™re also excited to share our goal to launch our Public Test Servers in just a few weeks! ğŸ™Œ Expect it to take place in March and before Patch 7. Once we get a specific date, weâ€™ll make an official statement on our socials and Discord! This will give you early access to upcoming features and the opportunity to share your feedback, helping us refine the content before its official release. It will exclusively happen on Steam, neither on EGS nor consoles. It will be very easy to install because it will act as a separate game. COMMUNITY FEEDBACK ON THE NEW ABSOLUTE DIFFICULTY - A word from our Game Director We would like to hear your opinion regarding Absolute difficulty. Overall, we are quite happy with how intense the difficulty itself is. We see that it requires a lot of concentration and we feel like itâ€™s fun in terms of how many enemies you have to face, how hard they hit you etc. At the same time, we see some comments that itâ€™s a bit easy. Yet on the other hand we donâ€™t want to mess it up and would like to hear the voice of the community first. Here is some data and context. According to our stats, the average win rate on Absolute difficulty is ~60% (significantly higher than Lethal difficulty that sits at 50%), which seems a bit higher than we expected. At the same time such high win rate is explained by three facts: Absolute difficulty is locked for new use...

Watch the trailer now! ğŸ‘‡ New challenges and rewards in the Datavault! ğŸ“š Directly accessible through the Armoury, todayâ€™s main addition comes in the form of the Datavault, a brand new Battle-Barge chamber where Tech-Priests collect and store intel on the many enemies of the Imperium. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/1bcacc5ebb168ffe9f137a78eb8a60dfd37bfebb.jpg By completing Ordeals, you will accumulate Research Data that you will be able to trade for Requisition Points and new cosmetics like pauldron markings, weapon skins (Thunder Hammer, Auto Bolt Rifle) and even new armor pieces (breastplate, gauntlet). {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/91ab5714125468ff04fa38f66029339a0bec4891.png New map in Eternal War & Biovore in Operations Eternal War mode gets a brand new Necron-themed PvP map named â€œTombâ€. ğŸª¦ Operations players on the other hand, will need to keep an eye out for the new Tyranid Biovore, a devastating Majoris enemy able to deal damage both from afar and up close. ğŸ¦‚ {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/6d9012f8c0aeb73ce1137893578cb67d3b475b3e.jpg {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/81adbec012f346c50d1cf5e82667776ccc384592.jpg {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/cecf8aeb84657488f907386491e649743daf7735.jpg {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/85504f5e9b8ffe58f0ef7f70f537c40e61c43e46.jpg Season Pass brings the Raven Guard and Salamanders ğŸ¦â€â¬›ğŸ¦ Season Pass owners today receive the Raven Guard Cosmetic Pack and the Salamanders Champion Pack. title: 6.0 Datavault Update - Patch Notes
contents: Hi Space Marines! ğŸ«¡ The 6.0 Datavault Update comes with a whole lot of quality of life improvements and brand new features. Check out all of the additions, features and updates listed in our patch notes below! In order, we will detail: The new features Battle Barge Extension: Datavault New PvP Map â€œTombâ€ New enemy Biovore Emotes System Armoury Data Refinement New PvE Difficulty: Absolute FOV Slider Opt in PvP Crossplay option for consoles New Finishers Additional Mastery for Full Progression Quick Match Bonus New Season Pass Content Salamander Champion Pack Raven Guard Cosmetic Pack Gameplay & Balancing Perk Update (in order: tactical, assault, vanguard, sniper, heavy, bulwark) Weapon Perks (Melee Weapons Update / Firearms for PvE only, etc) Gameplay QoL Letâ€™s deep dive into it! ğŸ‘‡ {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/aa98cd0755a64f208304d14999d3f21983f6a4df.jpg {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/0a6ea410f462d2a5b6950db04e11ef0cb86b247b.png â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €â €New Features {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/0a6ea410f462d2a5b6950db04e11ef0cb86b247b.png Battle Barge Expansion: Datavault The Datavault is a new area on the Battle Barge. Players can complete Ordeals in Campaign, Operations and Eternal War modes to challenge their skill and earn Research Data currency. In the Research Center players can unlock Exploration in the Research Center is rewarded with different rewards: 4 new icons for the right pauldron, 2 new weapon skins and 2 new armour parts. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/1bcacc5ebb168ffe9f137a78eb8a60dfd37bfebb.jpg New PvP Map: Tomb This PvP map is based around a similar structure to our other maps, but utilizes a different approach to the design of battle zones. Overall, Tomb is the smallest map of all the PvP maps. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/0944da711460b17398eae901c8f477de837cb5a8.jpg New Enemy: Biovore We have added a new Extremis enemy for the Tyranids, the Biovore. It is a fast, mobile living-artillery creature that can keep the distance, fortify and shoot spore mines in its enemies. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/daecab1a0acf4c1a4d1de9b32da668b5e5e1fddf.jpg Emotes System We have added an in-game emote system that includes a pound to the chest, a battle cry, and even a stoic handshake. You can use any of the 6 emotes in any game mode via the emote wheel. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/9b98b9c43156bec5c0a4230aa5f389ff1c43facd.gif Armoury Data Refinement We added a new Tech-Priest workshop in the Armoury of the Battle Barge. It is an exchange point where the player can: Exchange low tier Armoury Data to higher tier variants. Sell Armoury Data in exchange for Requisition points. This will allow players to obtain relic armoury data without having to beat higher difficulties. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/91ab5714125468ff04fa38f66029339a0bec4891.png New PvE Difficulty: Absolute This difficulty is focused on new, more diverse enemy packs that bring extreme challenge. Resources and ammo are aslo limited. You must be in the title screen settings to toggle this option. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/36a4c725e87140f17db3ab6c7251e55a1d08e1a0.png New Finishers New finisher animations have been added to purge the xenos and traitors with style: 1 for Zoanthrope; 2 for Rubric Marines; 1 for Scarab Occult Terminator. Additional Mastery for Full Progression When a weapon is fully upgraded, the player is now awarded an additional mastery point (works retroactively). Quick Match Bonus Players will now receive additional bonus XP if they play in Quick Match, as a compensation for not being able to select the Operation theyâ€™re playing. {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/0a6ea410f462d2a5b6950db04e11ef0cb86b247b.png â €â €â €â €â €â €â €New Season Pass Content {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/0a6ea410f462d2a5b6950db04e11ef0cb86b247b.png Added: Salamanders Champion Pack (Sniper class) {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/a62bc19a1e9e19f11e45fce9f8375b8a7e275d7f.jpg Added: Raven Guard Cosmetic Pack {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/ec80a47041d92b72324d6dca4171aa8161be0ee9.jpg Customisation Shared slots for Skins Recolour: Added a new slots tab in the customiser for Shared Colour Presets. title: January Community Update
contents: Greetings Space Marines, New Year, New Content! We hear you're hungry for content, and we're happy to see how excited you are about the game! First off, please donâ€™t forget to check the roadmap for 2025! Worry not, even if this roadmap ends in 2025, that doesnâ€™t mean the game will not receive new content after that! But first things first, letâ€™s focus on this year. If you missed it, the updated roadmap is here: {STEAM_CLAN_IMAGE}/43315296/0d21154a89b3463d365f0e7355c8c3a332d35a70.jpg Secondly, we'd like to remind you that Space Marine 2 will continually be updated with content and technical support throughout 2025. Youâ€™ll progressively get new skins, new PvP and PvE maps, custom lobbies for PvP, the Horde Mode is coming this year as well, PvE prestige ranks and new weapons as well. ğŸ”¥ Community Events will also keep coming throughout the year. The Datavault Update weâ€™re about to break down will arrive in February! ğŸ’™ Thank you for your unwavering support Space Marine 2 has been out for 4 months, and your continued enthusiasm means the world to us. Weâ€™re not done with it! You can expect updates every two months. Weâ€™d love to do more, but weâ€™re committed to delivering polished updates, which takes time and care! Thank you for your patience, understanding, and unwavering support. NEW PVP MAP - TOMB A new PvP map is about to be implemented in the 6.0 update! We already hinted that it will be set in a closed environment with many narrow passages pushing you to engage more in Closed Quartered Battles.
